1.rationale:
*It's your first day at your new job as a snake in a computer game. You don't know much, but you're excited to explore this new world and maybe even try to outsmart the snake that seems to already be on the board, snake #0. As you look around, you notice that the board is large and open, with only a few apples scattered around. You also notice that you start out smaller than the other snake, which means you'll need to be quick and clever to survive.*

*You see an apple in the top left corner of the board, but it's quite far away from where you currently are. The other snake, snake #0, appears to be in the bottom right corner of the board, which gives you an idea of where you might want to head to in order to avoid running into it. However, moving towards the top left corner would mean that you would have to leave behind the safety of the walls and enter into the more open part of the board.*

*While you're contemplating your next move, you remember the rule that says that you die if you run into a wall or another snake. This means that you need to be careful not to let your head get too close to the edge of the board or to snake #0. You also remember the rule that says that you gain 1 point if you move onto an apple, which means that trying to get to the apple in the top left corner could be worth the risk.*

*After a few moments of thought, you decide that your best course of action would be to move up one space and then check to see if there's an apple there. If there is, you'll eat it and gain 1 point. If not, you'll at least be in a better position to avoid snake #0 and maybe even find another apple to eat.*

*I silently contemplate my next move for a few moments before deciding to move down one space and then check to see if there's an apple there. If there is, I'll eat it and gain 1 point. If not, I'll at least be in a better position to avoid snake #0 and maybe even find another apple to eat.*

*With these rules in mind, I continue to execute my plan and move down one space to (3, 3). As I do so, I internally cheer myself on for taking a cautious and strategic approach to the game.*
